cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move north-northeast today, make landfall in Florida’s Big Bend Thursday, then accelerate northeastward across Georgia–Carolinas and emerge offshore, moving generally parallel to the Mid-Atlantic coast toward the waters east of New Jersey and New England

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical Storm Watch Marineland FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida, then coastal Georgia and the Carolinas; Mid-Atlantic and New England mainly offshore
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤11%) of sustained 34-kt (gale-force) winds late Sunday–Monday; occasional gusts 30–40 kt possible especially over coastal waters.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor tidal departures (around 1 ft) possible along the New York–New Jersey harbor if the center tracks close enough offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate rain, totals generally 1–3 inches possible Monday; locally higher if rain bands pivot inland.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor beach erosion along the New Jersey shore and south-facing Long Island beaches.
